item.title: 270. Self inconsistency, self conflict and finding your authentic self | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description Do you live a life that’s true to your authentic self? In this episode I’m exploring the concept of the authentic self, what it means to be happy and how you can tap into it more effectively. I’m also jumping into the idea of self inconsistency and self conflict. Together these concepts will help you understand more about what it is that makes you happy, and how to live that life more authentically.

item.title: 269. Imposter Syndrome and The Psychology of Your 20s with Jemma Sbeg | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description My beautiful beans I’m joined by the amazing Jemma Sbeg, host of the podcast The Psychology of Your 20s. We’re talking all about quarter-life-crises, imposter syndrome, finding friends, and figuring your shit out. item.title: 267. 8 Steps to Overcome Burnout | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description What actually IS burnout and how can you get through it/over it. I’m going to take you through my 8 steps to overcome it and how to differentiate stress from burnout. BRAIN FACT: The impact of alcohol on sleep and it’s interaction with your neurochemistry when sleeping. LISTENER QUESTION: A bean gets in touch with what sounds like a very unhealthy relationship, asking for my advice on whether they should stay together or go their separate ways.

item.title: 266. Rebuilding yourself after divorce and heartbreak with Renee Chagoury | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description How do you rebuild your identity after a divorce? How do you find yourself after breakup with children? Renee Chagoury is one of my oldest mates, a single mum of two girls, a schoolteacher and the founder of Sole Sisters Run Club. Her journey of rebuilding herself after a breakup instils hope that there is something else out there that you can do from the inside out that will make you a better person.

item.title: 265. How to make the rest of the year the BEST of the year | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description How do you make the best of the rest of the year? Today’s episode is all about how to feel like you have milked the last few weeks of out of life. There is so much that you can do in this final month of to really make the most of it. Brain Fact: The story of the woman who had a worm in her brain! The 4 ways you can get a parasite living inside you (skip ahead to around 11 minutes if you’re squeamish)

item.title: 264. Are you getting used to a life you don't want? | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description This ep is a juicy one. I’m talking about getting comfortable because it’s easy, rather than challenging and pushing yourself toward a life you actually want. We’re talking about the signs you’re slipping into a pattern, living up to someone else’s ideals instead of your own, not knowing what you want, feeling lost and frustrated, and how to start to turn it all around. Listener Question: I’ve struggled to set boundaries my whole life and people often walk all over me.

item.title: 263. Dealing with the pressure of having it all figured out by 30 | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description Why does turning 30 come with so much pressure to have your shit together? I’m going to explore WHY we feel like we need to have our life sorted by 30, and how to get out of that comparison loop and just live your life no matter your age or stage. Listener Question: I'm from England but have established a life in Australia. My long distance boyfriend has put it to me that I should come back to England to start our lives together and I don't know what to do.

item.title: 262. How to rewrite your reputation | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description Let's talk reputation my beans: what it is, how you get one and MOST importantly how you can change your reputation if you've got a baaad one. Brain Fact: The Ceiling Effect in pharmacology . Listener Question: Me and an ex bestie had a falling out a few years ago but I still have to interact with them in group settings. It’s hard but I do it cause I don’t wanna miss out on group things with mates.

item.title: 257. The neuroscience of ketamine and it's effects on depression | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description Why is Ketamine being used to treat depression and anhedonia? In this science-y episode I'm going through the neuroscience of Ketamine and the brain, the chemical makeup of the drug, and why it's being used in many trials to treat people with treatment resistant depression and anhedonia. BRAIN FACT: ECT therapy – what is It, how does it work, what type of mental disorders is it used as a treatment for.

item.description: Podcast Description Do you know if you are setting the bar too low for yourself, your relationships and your career / abilities? item.title: 255. 10 Years of Friendship with Steph Claire Smith and Laura Henshaw | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description Adult friendships can be harrrrrd – and being in business with a mate is even harder. In this episode I’m joined by two friends who seem to have it figured out! Steph Claire Smith and Laura Henshaw, founders of KIC – the wellbeing and lifestyle community that’s an app and a podcast (kinda like us!). They talk all about the friendship, their relationships with their bodies, and how they got to where they are today.

item.title: 253. Missed Opportunities: Becoming OK with the shots you didn't take | Do You F*cking Mind?
item.description: Podcast Description You can spend your whole life thinking about a bad decision that you mad . or the opportunity you didn’t take, or mistakes you made. In fact most people do! It can be crippling, so I want to take you through the ways you can live a life without regret, and reclaim contentment in your decisions. PET LOVE: Watch 'Lupin' on Netflix https://bit.ly/lupin-trailer . SBS Podcasts ‘Learn a Language’ https://bit.

item.description: Podcast Description Why do we struggle to be aware of ourselves? It’s hard to turn the lense on yourself, particularly during the bad shit. I’m going to take you through how to practice self awareness and level up your life (and how to stop being the kind of person to throw blame instead of apologise). Pet Love: Listen to The Dream Podcast https://bit.ly/thedream-podcast . Brain Fact: Exploring Corpus Callosum https://bit.ly/corpus-callosum .

Is this normal? And how do I figure out if I’m being left out on purpose or if it’s just a misunderstanding.
